favourite.article: I love this beautiful song since I was a kid. We used to sing it in the Church. It lifted me and my spirit high whenever I sing and listen to it. It makes my tears flow. Its so touching and encouraging knowing that my God promises and always with me all the time. These days whenever I am sitting with my keyboard I start singing this song. I love all the lines ..... especially the last stanza "Steps unseen before me, Hidden dangers near; Nearer still my Saviour, Whispering, "Be of cheer", Joy, like birds of springtime, To my heart have flown, Singing all so sweet, "He will not leave me alone".... ðŸŽ¶ðŸŽµðŸŽ¼ðŸŽ»ðŸŽ¹ðŸŽ·ðŸŽº
The song is so touching and encouraging...every time I sing it, I feel uplifted anew...I love it. It reminds me am never alone..All praises be to God!

Thanks for sharing. I read this song this morning. I love this song. In this moment, it encourages me that His love will be with me forever and ever, never change. wherever I go, "fear not, I will be with you." Hallelujah! praise and thanks be to Him!
My mother used to sing this song often, some 40 years ago. I used to hum once in a while when I needed courage as I concentrate more on the verse.
Wonderful it is to be loved by Godâ€”Maker of the world.
Praise God for this reminder that I am never alone.

This affirms the truths in John 14:18, and Hebrews 13:5-6 that in all our crisis of bereavement and loss the Lord promises to stand beside me and that I am never alone. What a comfort! He is 'Immanuel' and His Presence and love are all we need. He is and will be sufficient for us. Halleluia!

This song is such a sweet reminder that despite how sometimes we feel like God has deserted us, we can still hold on to the beautiful promise He made to us. He promises never to leave us alone. So, we should take courage and lift our faith because He is right there. When the fight gets too much for us, He will step in and take it over. He has, not stored in yet because despite our doubts, He knows we have the strength we need to overcome.
Yes, fear not, I am with thee. How true the words are that make me stronger.
How wonderful this song, it helps me going on this pilgrim. God bless everyone who listen to it.
Praised be His holy name forever. Amen.

Wonderful soul-thrilling song that keeps the soul rocking to every beat especially in your trying times. "He whispers, be of good cheer". Good old time song "sound" encouraging words. God bless the writer that pened these words...
What a great hymn! May Jesus be with us always.
I like this song. May God blesses us.
NO! I WILL NEVER EVER LEAVE THE LORD! He promised me He will never leave me and He will keep me safe and sound with Him for the the rest my life to be shared with Him; my Shield and rock and Saviour.

This song is really good! Today is the first time I heard it. "Roses fade around me, Lilies bloom and die, Earthly sunbeams vanish," but Jesus! Jesus our Beloved Jesus! So present, so real, always new! With us today and with us till the end!
How wonderful that we do not have to wait until our roses fade and our earthly sunbeams vanish, today and at any time we can take Him as our Habitation, our dwelling place! And thus enjoy His very, sweet, always prevailing presence.
He is watching over me. I have no fear.

This song reminds me of my childhood when I used to sing it most of the time. This song was like my breath. Still today at the age of 29 also, I like this song very much. This is the song that strengthened me at times of trouble, during my hostel days, when my parents were not with me. Truly He never left me lonely.

I remember when I was in my age of 6 I sang this song with my grandma when she was 78 (and now she is no more) and one of my friends today asked the lyrics of this song to sing to her mother who felt sick and she asked her to sing the same song to her mother in her last bed days... I really like this song very much and I believe this same song will comfort me also during my last breath I love my Jesus. Janetta

This song reminds me of my college days at Moi university in Kenya. We would go to Marakwet and Kerio valley with my friends to preach the gospel of Jesus there. A friend of mine called Zipporah taught me the song. And it has been such an encouragement all these days.
